solution_line_template: To compare volumes, the measurements must be in the same units. There are {inches_per_foot} inches in 1 ft, so Sara's birdhouse is {sara_width_ft} ft x {inches_per_foot} inches/ft = {sara_width_in} inches wide, {sara_height_ft} ft x {inches_per_foot} inches/ft = {sara_height_in} inches tall, and {sara_depth_ft} ft x {inches_per_foot} inches/ft = {sara_depth_in} inches deep.

The volume of Sara's birdhouse is {sara_width_in} inches x {sara_height_in} inches x {sara_depth_in} inches = <<{sara_width_in}*{sara_height_in}*{sara_depth_in}={sara_volume}>>{sara_volume} cubic inches

The volume of Jake's birdhouse is {jake_width_in} inches x {jake_height_in} inches x {jake_depth_in} inches = <<{jake_width_in}*{jake_height_in}*{jake_depth_in}={jake_volume}>>{jake_volume} cubic inches.
The difference between the two birdhouses is {sara_volume} cubic inches - {jake_volume} cubic inches = <<{sara_volume}-{jake_volume}={volume_difference}>>{volume_difference} cubic inches.
